data.name: FilterView_Deblock
data.value: Deblock zmenšuje čtvercové artefakty způsobené nízkou kvalitou video komprese.

data.name: FilterView_DecombDeinterlace
data.value:
Zvolte parametry filtru decomb nebo deinterlace.
Filtr decomb selektivně eliminuje prokládání snímků, na kterých je prokládání patrné. To zachová kvalitu snímků, které prokládané nejsou.
Klasický filtr deinterlace eliminuje prokládání u všch snímků. U snímků, které nejsou prokládané dojde k určitému snížení kvality.

data.name: FilterView_Denoise
data.value:
Denoise snižuje nebo odstraňuje viditelný šum a zrno. To může zvýšit účinost komprese a dosáhnout vyšší kvality videa v menším souboru. Příliš silný filtr denoise může snížit kvalitu obrazu odstraněním detailů.
NLMeans je vysoce kvalitní filtr šumu, který vyžaduje velký výpočetní výkon. Užijte pokud je kvalita výstupu důležitější než rychlost zpracování.
HQDN3D je adaptivní low-pass filtr, který je rychlejší než NLMeans, ale s menší účinností zachovává drobné detaily.

data.name: FilterView_Detelecine
data.value: Detelecine odstraňuje hřebenové artefakty vzniklé při procesu telecine - převodu snímkové frekvence filmového pásu na snímkovou frekvenci televizního signálu.

data.name: FilterView_Grayscale
data.value: Grayscale removes the color component of the video. Often referred to as Black & White video.

data.name: MainView_Destination
data.value: Cílová složka, včetně cesty a názvu souboru. Toto určuje umístění a název výsledného souboru.

data.name: MainView_IpodAtom
data.value: Vložit speciální MP4 značku, která umožní přehrání na původním iPodu 5. generace z roku 2006. Jiná nastavení mohou také mít vliv na kompatibilitu.

data.name: MainView_Mux
data.value: Formát kontejneru videa. Určuje typ souboru, do kterého se kombinují stopy videa, zvuku atd. Má vliv na kompatibilitu s přehrávači.

data.name: MainView_Optimise
data.value: Optimalizovat MP4 na postupné stahování. Po konverzi jsou data přeřazena a zapsána způsobem, který umožní okamžité přehrávání videa přes síť bez nutnosti stáhnout celý soubor.

data.name: MainView_Range
data.value: Volba rozsahu zdrojového videa. Ve výchozím stavu jsou zvoleny všechny kapitoly a proběhne konverze celého zdroje.

data.name: MainView_Title
data.value: Titul nebo video klip ke konverzi. Disky Blu-ray a DVD mají často více titulů, nejdelší z nich je typicky hlavní obsah.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_Anamorphic
data.value:
Anamorphic allows arbitrary storage dimensions while preserving the original aspect during playback.
None disables anamorphic. Video storage dimensions and display dimensions will be identical. Only useful for compatibility with certain legacy devices.
Automatic maximizes storage resolution while preserving the original display aspect ratio. Recommended.
Custom allows manually setting all parameters. Useful for correcting an incorrect source display aspect and for professionals needing advanced control in post-production.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_AutoCrop
data.value: Automatický ořez černých pruhů kolem okrajů videa.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_CropBottom
data.value: Ořez videa ze spodu.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_CropLeft
data.value: Ořez videa z levé strany.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_CropRight
data.value: Ořez videa z pravé strany.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_CropTop
data.value: Ořez videa ze shora.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_Height
data.value: Výška ukládaného videa v pixelech. Zobrazovaná výška videa se může lišit, pokud poměr stran pixelu není 1:1.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_ManualCrop
data.value: Ruční ořez videa.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_Modulus
data.value:
Zarovnat rozlišení uloženého videa na násobek této hodnoty.
Toto nastavení je nutné pouze pro zvýšení kompatibility s některými přehrávači. Zvolte hodnotu 2 pokud nemáte problémy s kompatibilitou.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_PAR
data.value: Poměr stran pixelu určuje tvar pixelů. Čtvercový pixel má poměr stran 1:1. Jiné poměry určují obdélníkové pixely. Přehrávače mění poměr stran zobrazovaného videa aby dosáhly požadovaného formátu.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_Width
data.value: Šířka ukládaného videa v pixelech. Zobrazovaná šířka videa se může lišit, pokud poměr stran pixelu není 1:1.

data.name: QueueView_DeleteJob
data.value: Odstranit úlohu z fronty.

data.name: QueueView_ResetJobStatus
data.value: Resetovat stav úlohy na čekající.

data.name: QueueView_SendJobBack
data.value: Odeslat úlohu zpět do hlavního okna k úpravám.

data.name: Video_AvgBitrate
data.value:
Nastavte průměrný bitrate, tedy počet bitů za sekundu.
Okamžitá hodnota bitrate může být mnohem vyšší nebo nižší v průběhu videa. Průměrná hodnota za dlouhý úsek videa bude odpovídat průměrnému bitrate určenému zde. Pokud chcete omezit nejvyšší okamžitý bitrate, v kodeku x264 upravte parametry vbv-bufsize a vbv-maxrate.

data.name: Video_ConstantFramerate
data.value: Povolí konstantní výstupní snímkovou frekvenci.

data.name: Video_Encoders
data.value: Video kodeky k dispozici.

data.name: Video_EncoderTune
data.value:
Vyladit nastavení na obvyklé scénáře.
Tímto můžete zvýšit účinnost pro některé typy zdrojů, nebo určit charakter výstupního souboru. Změny budou nastaveny po načtení předvolby, ale před všemi dalšími parametry.

data.name: Video_ExtraOpts
data.value:
Další nastavení kodeku.
Seznam parametrů oddělených středníkem.

data.name: Video_FastDecode
data.value:
Snížit využití CPU dekodérem.
Zvolte pokud vaše zařízení nestíhá přehrát výstup (nezobrazené snímky)

data.name: Video_Framerate
data.value:
Output framerate.
'Same as source' is recommended. If your source video has a variable framerate, 'Same as source' will preserve it.

data.name: Video_Level
data.value:
Sets and ensures compliance with the specified level.
Overrides all other settings.

data.name: Video_PeakFramerate
data.value: Enables variable framerate output with a peak rate determined by the framerate setting.

data.name: Video_Presets
data.value:
Adjusts encoder settings to trade off compression efficiency against encoding speed.
This establishes your default encoder settings. Tunes, profiles, levels and advanced option string will be applied to this. You should generally set this option to the slowest you can bear since slower settings will result in better quality or smaller files.
Adjust the slider to the right to increase compression efficiency at the expense of encoding speed, or to the left to increase encoding speed at the expense of compression efficiency.

data.name: Video_Profile
data.value:
Sets and ensures compliance with the specified profile.
Overrides all other settings.

data.name: Video_Quality
data.value:
Set the desired quality factor. The encoder targets a certain quality. The scale used by each video encoder is different.
x264's scale is logarithmic and lower values correspond to higher quality. So small decreases in value will result in progressively larger increases in the resulting file size. A value of 0 means lossless and will result in a file size that is larger than the original source, unless the source was also lossless. Suggested values are: 18 to 20 for standard definition sources and 20 to 23 for high definition sources.
FFMpeg's and Theora's scale is more linear. These encoders do not have a lossless mode.

data.name: Video_TurboAnalysisPass
data.value: During the analysis pass of a multi pass encode, use settings that speed things along.

data.name: Video_MultiPass
data.value:
Perform Multi Pass Encoding.
The 'Bitrate' option is prerequisite. During the analysis passes, statistics about the video are collected. Then in the final pass, those statistics are used to make bitrate allocation decisions.

data.name: Video_VariableFramerate
data.value:
Enables variable framerate output.
VFR is not compatible with some players.

data.name: MainView_WhenDone
data.value: When HandBrake has finished the current queue or encode it will perform this action.

data.name: MainView_Browse
data.value: Browse to select a new destination path and file name for your encode.

data.name: MainView_Angle
data.value: Video angle to encode. Only applicable to multi-angle DVD and Blu-ray.

data.name: MainView_AddPreset
data.value: Přidat novou předvolbu.

data.name: MainView_PresetAdditionalOptions
data.value: Additional Preset Options.

data.name: MainView_Presets
data.value:
Presets are groups of encode settings tailored for specific scenarios. Select the one closest matching your intent.
Overrides all encode settings. Settings may be further adjusted after selecting a preset.

data.name: MainView_RemovePreset
data.value: Remove the selected preset.

data.name: SourceSelection_TitleSpecific
data.value:
Some Sources may contain more than one video clip, or a collection of Titles. Blu-ray and DVD Sources often have multiple Titles.
If you know the specific title you wish to encode you can enter it here and HandBrake will scan only that title rather than every title in the source file. Otherwise, leave the field blank.

data.name: FilterView_CustomDenoiseParams
data.value:
Custom Denoise parameters.
NLMeans syntax: y-strength=y:y-origin-tune=y:y-patch-size=y:y-range=y:y-frame-count=y:y-prefilter=y:cb-strength=c:cb-origin-tune=c:cb-patch-size=c:cb-range=c:cb-frame-count=c:cb-prefilter=c:cr-strength=c:cr-origin-tune=c:cr-patch-size=c:cr-range=c:cr-frame-count=c:cr-prefilter=c:threads=t
NLMeans default: y-strength=6:y-origin-tune=1:y-patch-size=7:y-range=3:y-frame-count=2:y-prefilter=0:cb-strength=6:cb-origin-tune=1:cb-patch-size=7:cb-range=3:cb-frame-count=2:cb-prefilter=0
HQDN3D syntax: y-spatial=y:cb-spatial=c:cr-spatial=c:y-temporal=y:cb-temporal=c:cr-temporal=c
HQDN3D default: y-spatial=3:cb-spatial=2:cr-spatial=2:y-temporal=2:cb-temporal=3:cr-temporal=3

data.name: FilterView_DenoisePreset
data.value: Denoise filter preset. Sets the strength of the filter.

data.name: FilterView_DenoiseTune
data.value:
Denoise tune. Further adjusts the Denoise preset to optimize settings for specific scenarios.
- None uses the default preset settings.
- Film refines settings for use with most live action content.
- Grain only processes color channels. Useful for preserving the film-like look of luminance grain while reducing or removing color noise.
- High Motion reduces color smearing in high motion scenes by avoiding temporal processing for color channels. Useful for sports and action videos.
- Animation is useful for cel animation such as anime and cartoons.
- Tape is useful for low-detail analog tape sources such as VHS, where Film does not produce a desirable result.
- Sprite is useful for 1-/4-/8-/16-bit 2-dimensional games. Sprite is not designed for high definition video.

data.name: FilterView_Deinterlace
data.value:
Deinterlace removes comb artifacts from the picture.
Bwdif and Yadif are two popular and fast deinterlacers.
Decomb switches between multiple interpolation algorithms for speed and quality.

data.name: FilterView_DeinterlaceCustom
data.value:
Custom Deinterlace parameters.
Bwdif and Yadif syntax: mode=m:parity=p
Bwdif and Yadif default: mode=3
Decomb syntax: mode=m:magnitude-thresh=m:variance-thresh=v:laplacian-thresh=l:dilation-thresh=d:erosion-thresh=e:noise-thresh=n:search-distance=s:postproc=p:parity=p
Decomb default: mode=7

data.name: FilterView_DeinterlacePreset
data.value:
Předvolba filtru Deinterlace.
Výchozí je dobře vyvážený pro rychlost a kvalitu.
Přeskočit prostorovou kontrolu umožňuje Yadifu přeskočit opravu některých artefaktů, kterým se lze vyhnout, a mírně tak zvýšit rychlost.
EEDI2 používá pomalejší, ale kvalitnější interpolační algoritmus pro Decomb. Užitečné pro ty nejobtížnější zdroje.
Bob se snaží lépe zachovat pohyb za mírnou újmu na vnímaném rozlišení.

data.name: FilterView_Flip
data.value: Flips (mirrors) the picture on the horizontal axis.

data.name: FilterView_InterlaceDetection
data.value: Interlace Detection, when enabled, allows the Deinterlace filter to only process interlaced video frames.

data.name: FilterView_InterlaceDetectionCustom
data.value:
Custom Interlace Detection parameters.
Syntax: mode=m:spatial-metric=s:motion-thresh=m:spatial-thresh=s:filter-mode=f:block-thresh=b:block-width=b:block-height=b:disable=d
Default: mode=3:spatial-metric=2:motion-thresh=1:spatial-thresh=1:filter-mode=2:block-thresh=40:block-width=16:block-height=16

data.name: FilterView_Rotate
data.value: Rotate the picture clockwise in 90 degree increments.

data.name: MainView_Duration
data.value: Duration of the selected source range in Hours:Minutes:Seconds

data.name: PictureSettingsView_KeepAR
data.value: Keep Aspect Ratio maintains the original display aspect of the source. Disabling this may result in a stretched or squeezed picture.

data.name: FilterView_CustomSharpenParams
data.value:
Custom Sharpen parameters.
Unsharp syntax: y-strength=y:y-size=y:cb-strength=c:cb-size=c:cr-strength=c:cr-size=c
Unsharp default: y-strength=0.25:y-size=7:cb-strength=0.25:cb-size=7
Lapsharp syntax: y-strength=y:y-kernel=y:cb-strength=c:cb-kernel=c:cr-strength=c:cr-kernel=c
Lapsharp default: y-strength=0.2:y-kernel=isolap:cb-strength=0.2:cb-kernel=isolap

data.name: FilterView_Sharpen
data.value:
Sharpening enhances the appearance of detail, especially edges. Overly strong Sharpen settings may damage picture quality by creating ringing artifacts and enhancing noise, which can reduce compression efficiency.
Unsharp is a general purpose unsharp masking filter. It sharpens by blurring, then calculating the difference between the blurred picture and the original.
Lapsharp sharpens using convolution kernels approximating Laplacian edge filters, sometimes producing higher quality results than unsharp masking.

data.name: FilterView_SharpenPreset
data.value: Předvolba filtru Ostření. Nastavuje sílu filtru.

data.name: FilterView_SharpenTune
data.value:
Sharpen tune. Further adjusts the Sharpen preset to optimize settings for specific scenarios.
None uses the default preset settings.
Unsharp can be tuned for Ultrafine, Fine, Medium, Coarse, or Very Coarse sharpening. Select one based on the output picture resolution and fineness of detail to enhance.
Lapsharp's Film tune refines settings for use with most live action content. Film uses an isotropic Laplacian kernel to sharpen all edges similarly, and luminance (brightness) information is sharpened more than chrominance (color) information.
Lapsharp's Grain tune is similar to Film, but uses an isotropic Laplacian of Gaussian kernel to reduce the effect on noise and grain. Useful for preserving grain and as a general alternative to the Film tune.
Lapsharp's Animation tune is useful for cel animation such as anime and cartoons. Animation is identical to Film, but overall strength is reduced to avoid creating artifacts.
Lapsharp's Sprite tune is useful for 1-/4-/8-/16-bit 2-dimensional games. Sprite uses a 4-neighbor Laplacian kernel that enhances vertical and horizontal edges more than diagonal edges.

data.name: MainView_AlignAVStart
data.value: Aligns the initial timestamps of all audio and video streams by inserting blank frames or dropping frames. May improve audio/video sync for broken players that do not honor MP4 edit lists.

data.name: MainView_PresetOptionsContextMenu
data.value: Options to control presets.

data.name: MainView_EndPoint
data.value: The end point for this range.

data.name: MainView_StartPoint
data.value: The start point for this range.

data.name: OptionsView_AlwaysUseDefaultPath
data.value: When enabled the auto name system will always use the default path. When disabled, it will use the path in the destination box on the main window if populated, otherwise it will use the default path.

data.name: FiltersView_ColourSpace
data.value: Colourspace Filter.

data.name: FiltersView_ChromaSmooth
data.value: Chroma Smooth Filter

data.name: PictureSettingsView_PaddingCustomColourTooltip
data.value: This field can accept RGB values such as: "0xFF0000" or colour names such as "red". For a full list of named colours, see the padding filter documentation.

data.name: SubtitlesView_BurnIn
data.value:
Burn in subtitles to the video stream.
Note, this will be automatically selected if the source subtitle track format is not supported in the output file type.
For example, PGS subtitles are not supported in MP4

data.name: OptionsView_PresetDisplayModes
data.value: Flat - Presets are displayed as a flat list. Partially Flat - The last 8 user presets are displayed as a flat list followed by all presets being shown in category listing. Categories - All presets are shown under a sub menu per category.

data.name: AudioView_AudioDefaults
data.value: Setup behaviours that dictate how this tab automatically adds audio tracks when selecting a new source or title.

data.name: BehavioursReload
data.value: Refresh the list below based on the behaviours configured.

data.name: SubtitleView_SubtitleDefaults
data.value: Setup behaviours that dictate how this tab automatically adds subtitle tracks when selecting a new source or title.

data.name: OptionsView_SendFileToArguments
data.value:
The following environment variables are always set: HB_SOURCE HB_DESTINATION HB_EXIT_CODE
Possible Exit Codes are as follows: 0 : Successful 2 : Input Arguments Error 3 : Failed to Initialise 4 : Unknown Error 5 : Error reading source file.
Please note, errors codes are best effort and may not always be accurate. It is recommended the output file is validated before performing actions on it.

data.name: Options_AdditionalFormatOptions
data.value:
The format of the output file. In addition to any supported file system character, you can use the any of the placeholders that will be replaced when you change title or scan a source or update certain settings.
{source} - Name of the source file. {title} - Integer value. This is representative of a disc title number. {chapters} - The range of chapters selected. {creation-date} - The date that the source file was created on (if available). {creation-time} - The time that the source file was created on (if available). {modification-date} - The date that the source file was last modified on (if available). {modification-time} - The time that the source file was last modified on (if available). {date} - Today. Set at time of adding to the queue. {time} - Today. Set at time of adding to the queue. {quality_bitrate} - The RF/CQ number, or bitrate {quality_type} - Prints "kbps" or "Q" depending on the quality mode selected on the video tab. {preset} - Name of the preset selected. {encode_bit_depth} - Integer value. i.e. 8, 10 or 12 {width} - The output storage width {height} - The output storage height {codec} - Display the video format. {encoder} - Display the short format key of the encoder used.
Any illegal path characters will be removed automatically.

data.name: OptionsView_RightToleftMode
data.value:
For languages that are right to left, you can enable one of two modes. "Text Only" will only render the text in right to left style. "Entire User Interface" will render all controls in right to left.
Please note, there may be inperfections in the UI layout when using these modes. Depending on the language, it may be worth trying both modes to find the best fit.

data.name: AudioView_Quality
data.value:
Target a specific quality level for audio. 1 is lowest quality and 5 is highest quality.
Bitrate will vary source to source.

data.name: OptionsView_DestinationReplacementOptions
data.value:
The following can be used singularly, or together to build up a destination path
{source_path} - In the same folder as the source path (if possible) {source_folder_name} – The name of the directory that the source file is in, without the full path. {source} - The name of the source file.

data.name: OptionsView_LaunchsHelp
data.value: Launches the documentation website located at https://handbrake.fr/docs

data.name: Options_RemovePunctuation
data.value: Dash (-), Period (.) and Comma (,)

data.name: PictureSettingsView_OptimalSize
data.value: Use highest resolution permitted by above settings

data.name: PictureSettingsView_AllowUpscaling
data.value: If not enabled, scaled dimensions will be limited to source dimensions.

data.name: PictureSettingsView_AutomaticKeepAR
data.value: Changing the displays size will stretch the video
